meanings.definition: A device used in photography to produce a flash of artificial light.
meanings.sent1: The photographer attached the flashgun to the camera to capture well-lit photos.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to bring your flashgun to the photoshoot for better lighting.
meanings.sent3: When the flashgun went off unexpectedly, everyone in the room jumped in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The flashgun was like a tiny lightning bolt, illuminating the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The bright flash from the flashgun made the colors in the picture pop.

meanings.definition: To emit a sudden burst of light.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the lightning seemed to flashgun across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse will flashgun every few seconds to guide ships safely.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies in the garden seemed to flashgun in a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could flashgun brighter than any camera flash.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display will flashgun brilliantly in the night sky.
